page.title: 04DALLAS DHU West Forres
page.content: Wright and Greig,Scotch Whisky blenders of Glasgow began building the distillery in 1898.It was built because at that time there was a high demand for malt whisky.It was built in a hollow which had the advantage that the water supply came under pressure.In the 1930s Dallas Dhu closed down because of the economic depression and again between 1940 and 1947 because of wartime restrictions on the use of barley.In 1983 Dallas Dhu closed down because of a decline in the market for Scotch Whisky.There used to be fifteen people employed there but now there are only three maintaining the building and transferring the stock to other distilleries.The Scottish Development Department are interested in reopening the distillery as a museum showing how a Scottish Distillery operates.
